abstract: Macedonian Pres Gjorge Ivanov abruptly ends investigation into government corruption begun under agreement with European mediators and pardons all officials involved in wiretapping scandal that prompted agreement in July; decision sets off protests.

headline.print_headline: Protests Erupt in Macedonia as President Halts Wiretapping Inquiry
headline.main: Protests Erupt in Macedonia as President Halts Wiretapping Inquiry

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject

snippet: A special prosecutor had been investigating allegations of widespread corruption in government, but President Gjorge Ivanov issued a blanket pardon.
lead_paragraph: A special prosecutor had been investigating allegations of widespread corruption in government, but President Gjorge Ivanov issued a blanket pardon.
